summary: Feature request to support Pino as a logging framework alongside Winston in the TypeScript SDK. The issue was ultimately closed as the team decided the SDK should remain logger-framework agnostic, but maintainers provided guidance on implementing custom logging adapters.
userImpact: Users who prefer Pino logging must create custom adapters instead of having native SDK support for both Winston and Pino logging frameworks.
rootCause: SDK Logger interface was designed to be framework-agnostic but appears Winston-like, making it inconvenient for Pino users who need to implement workarounds.
proposedFix: The team suggested creating an adaptor class that exposes Pino-style log methods internally using the SDK's Logger signature, leveraging Runtime.logger for all log message funneling.
workaround: Create a custom logger adaptor class that wraps Pino with the SDK's Logger interface; use ActivityInboundLogInterceptor for activity logging (though deprecated); register custom logger sink for workflow logging.
resolutionDetails: Team decided SDK must remain logger-framework agnostic. Provided architectural guidance on implementing custom Pino adapters instead of adding native Pino support.
keyQuote: the SDK itself must remain logger-framework agnostic...there's not that much we can do within the SDK itself to simplify usage of alternate logging APIs
